properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 6:40AM CST until February 23 at 1:08AM CST by NWS Huntsville AL
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama...

Tennessee River at Florence affecting Colbert and Lauderdale
Counties

The Flood Warning continues for
the Tennessee River at Florence.
* until late Saturday night.
* At 6 AM Tuesday the stage was 21.4 feet and falling.
* Flood Stage is 18.0 feet.
* Minor Flooding is occurring and Minor Flooding is forecast.
* Recent activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at
6 AM Tuesday was 22.3 feet.
* Forecast...The river will continue to fall to below Flood Stage by
early Saturday afternoon.
* Impact...At 21.5 feet...Water covers the parking lot of the Marina
at McFarland Park...with extensive flooding occurring at the soccer
fields and golf course within the park. Water is also beginning to
cover the road that goes underneath U.S. Highways 43 and 72 at the
new playground.
* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.7 feet
on Mar 1 2018.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Do not attempt to drive through a flooded road. The
depth of water is not always obvious. As little as two feet of water
will carry most cars away. Also, the road bed may be washed out under
the water, and you could be stranded or trapped. Additional
information is available at http://water.weather.gov. Once there,
click on the Tennessee Valley to view local river information.
